title: Sinigang na Baboy (Pork Sinigang)

ingredients.name: pork spare ribs, cut into 2-inch pieces
bok choy or pechay, separated into leaves

steps: Rinse pork ribs and drain well.
In a pot over medium heat, combine pork with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, skimming scum from the surface.
Once broth clears, add tomatoes, onion, and fish sauce. Lower heat and simmer 1-1½ hours until meat is tender.
Add taro and cook 4-6 minutes until tender.
Add chili peppers and radish. Simmer 2-3 minutes.
Add long beans and cook 2 minutes.
Add eggplant and okra. Cook 1-2 minutes.
Add tamarind base powder and stir until dissolved. Season with salt and pepper.
Add bok choy and cook 1 minute.
notes: Volume conversions: 2 lbs pork ≈ 907g, 8 cups water ≈ 1900g, 2 large tomatoes ≈ 400g, 1 medium onion ≈ 150g, 2 tbsp fish sauce ≈ 30g, 1.5 packages tamarind powder ≈ 40g
Fresh tamarind alternative: Boil 15 tamarind pods with 1 cup water until soft, mash and strain
Maintain approximately 8 cups liquid throughout cooking
